00026 #ifndef VECADAPTOR_H
00027 #define VECADAPTOR_H
00028 
00029 #include <cstdlib>
00030 #include <iostream>
00031 #include <strstream>
00032 #include <cassert>
00033 
00034 #include "tnt/subscript.h"

00036 #ifdef TNT_USE_REGIONS

00040 namespace TNT
00041 {
00042 
00043 //  see "tntreq.h" for TNT requirements for underlying vector
00044 //  class.  This need NOT be the STL vector<> class, but a subset
00045 //  that provides minimal services.
00046 //
00047 //  This is a container adaptor that provides the following services.
00048 //
00049 //      o)  adds 1-offset operator() access ([] is always 0 offset)
00050 //      o)  adds TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK to () and []
00051 //      o)  adds initialization from strings, e.g.  "1.0 2.0 3.0";
00052 //      o)  adds newsize(N) function (does not preserve previous values)
00053 //      o)  adds dim() and dim(1)
00054 //      o)  adds free() function to release memory used by vector
00055 //      o)  adds regions, e.g. A(Index(1,10)) = ... 
00056 //      o)  add getVector() method to return adapted container
00057 //      o)  adds simple I/O for ostreams
00058 
00059 template <class BBVec>
00060 class Vector_Adaptor
00061 {
00062 
00063   public:
00064     typedef   typename BBVec::value_type T;
00065     typedef         T   value_type;
00066     typedef         T   element_type;
00067     typedef         T*  pointer;
00068     typedef         T*  iterator;
00069     typedef         T&  reference;
00070     typedef const   T*  const_iterator;
00071     typedef const   T&  const_reference;
00072     
00073     Subscript lbound() const { return 1; }
00074 
00075   protected:
00076     BBVec v_;
00077     T* vm1_;
00078 
00079   public:
00080 
00081     Subscript size() const { return v_.size(); }
00082 
00083     // These were removed so that the ANSI C++ valarray class
00084     // would work as a possible storage container.
00085     //
00086     //
00087     //iterator begin() { return v_.begin();}
00088     //iterator begin() { return &v_[0];}
00089     //
00090     //iterator end()   { return v_.end(); }
00091     //iterator end()   { return &v_[0] + v_.size(); }
00092     //
00093     //const_iterator begin() const { return v_.begin();}
00094     //const_iterator begin() const { return &v_[0];}
00095     //
00096     //const_iterator end()  const { return v_.end(); }
00097     //const_iterator end()  const { return &v_[0] + v_.size(); }
00098 
00099     BBVec& getVector() { return v_; }
00100     Subscript dim() const { return v_.size(); }
00101     Subscript dim(Subscript i)
00102     {
00103 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00104         assert(i==TNT_BASE_OFFSET);
00105 #endif
00106         return (i==TNT_BASE_OFFSET ? v_.size() : 0 );
00107     }
00108     Vector_Adaptor() : v_() {};
00109     Vector_Adaptor(const Vector_Adaptor<BBVec> &A) : v_(A.v_) 
00110     { 
00111         vm1_ = ( v_.size() > 0 ? &(v_[0]) -1 : NULL); 
00112 
00113     } 
00114 
00115     Vector_Adaptor(Subscript N, /*const*/ char *s) : v_(N) 
00116     {
00117         istrstream ins(s);
00118         for (Subscript i=0; i<N; i++)
00119             ins >> v_[i] ;
00120 
00121         vm1_ = ( v_.size() > 0 ? &(v_[0]) -1 : NULL); 
00122     }; 
00123 
00124     Vector_Adaptor(Subscript N, const T& value = T()) : v_(N)
00125     {
00126         for (Subscript i=0; i<N; i++)
00127              v_[i]  = value;
00128         
00129         vm1_ = ( v_.size() > 0 ? &(v_[0]) -1 : NULL); 
00130     }
00131 
00132     Vector_Adaptor(Subscript N, const T* values) : v_(N)
00133     {
00134         for (Subscript i=0; i<N; i++)
00135              v_[i]  = values[i];
00136         vm1_ = ( v_.size() > 0 ? &(v_[0]) -1 : NULL); 
00137     } 
00138     Vector_Adaptor(const BBVec & A) : v_(A) 
00139     {
00140         vm1_ = ( v_.size() > 0 ? &(v_[0]) -1 : NULL); 
00141     }
00142 
00143     // NOTE: this assumes that BBVec(0) constructor creates an 
00144     //  null vector that does not take up space...  It would be
00145     //  great to require that BBVec have a corresponding free()
00146     //  function, but in particular STL vectors do not.
00147     //
00148     Vector_Adaptor<BBVec>& free()
00149     {
00150         return *this = Vector_Adaptor<BBVec>(0);
00151     }
00152 
00153     Vector_Adaptor<BBVec>& operator=(const Vector_Adaptor<BBVec> &A) 
00154     { 
00155         v_ = A.v_ ; 
00156         vm1_ = ( v_.size() > 0 ? &(v_[0]) -1 : NULL); 
00157         return *this;
00158     }
00159 
00160     Vector_Adaptor<BBVec>& newsize(Subscript N)
00161     {
00162         // NOTE: this is not as efficient as it could be
00163         // but to retain compatiblity with STL interface
00164         // we cannot assume underlying implementation
00165         // has a newsize() function.
00166 
00167         return *this = Vector_Adaptor<BBVec>(N);
00168 
00169     }
00170 
00171     Vector_Adaptor<BBVec>& operator=(const T &a) 
00172     {
00173         Subscript i;
00174         Subscript N = v_.size();    
00175         for (i=0; i<N; i++)
00176             v_[i] = a;
00177 
00178         return *this;
00179     }
00180 
00181     Vector_Adaptor<BBVec>& resize(Subscript N) 
00182     { 
00183         if (N == size()) return *this;
00184 
00185         Vector_Adaptor<BBVec> tmp(N);
00186         Subscript n =  (N < size() ? N : size());  // min(N, size());
00187         Subscript i;
00188 
00189         for (i=0; i<n; i++)
00190             tmp[i] = v_[i];
00191             
00192 
00193         return (*this = tmp);
00194 
00195     }
00196 
00197 
00198     reference operator()(Subscript i)
00199     { 
00200 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00201         assert(1<=i);
00202         assert(i<=dim());
00203 #endif
00204         return vm1_[i]; 
00205     }
00206 
00207     const_reference operator()(Subscript i) const
00208     { 
00209 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00210         assert(1<=i);
00211         assert(i<=dim());
00212 #endif
00213         return vm1_[i]; 
00214     }
00215 
00216     reference operator[](Subscript i)
00217     { 
00218 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00219         assert(0<=i);
00220         assert(i<dim());
00221 #endif
00222         return v_[i]; 
00223     }
00224 
00225     const_reference operator[](Subscript i) const
00226     { 
00227 #ifdef TNT_BOUNDS_CHECK
00228         assert(0<=i);
00229         assert(i<dim());
00230 #endif
00231         return v_[i]; 
00232     }
00233 
00234 
00235 #ifdef TNT_USE_REGIONS
00236     // "index-aware" features, all of these are 1-based offsets
00237 
00238     typedef Region1D<Vector_Adaptor<BBVec> > Region;
00239 
00240     typedef const_Region1D< Vector_Adaptor<BBVec> > const_Region;
00241 
00242     Region operator()(const Index1D &I)
00243     {   return Region(*this, I); }
00244 
00245     Region operator()(const Subscript i1, Subscript i2)
00246     {   return Region(*this, i1, i2); }
00247 
00248     const_Region operator()(const Index1D &I) const
00249     {   return const_Region(*this, I); }
00250 
00251     const_Region operator()(const Subscript i1, Subscript i2) const
00252     {   return const_Region(*this, i1, i2); }
00253 #endif
00254 // TNT_USE_REGIONS
00255 
00256 
00257 };
00258 
00259 #include <iostream>
00260 
00261 template <class BBVec>
00262 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &s, const Vector_Adaptor<BBVec> &A)
00263 {
00264     Subscript M=A.size();
00265 
00266     s << M << endl;
00267     for (Subscript i=1; i<=M; i++)
00268             s << A(i) << endl;
00269     return s;
00270 }
00271 
00272 template <class BBVec>
00273 std::istream& operator>>(std::istream &s, Vector_Adaptor<BBVec> &A)
00274 {
00275     Subscript N;
00276     
00277     s >> N;
00278 
00279     A.resize(N);
00280 
00281     for (Subscript i=1; i<=N; i++)
00282         s >> A(i);
00283 
00284     return s;
00285 }
00286 
00287 } // namespace TNT

00289 #endif
